citeinfo.origin: Washington State Department of Transportation, GIS and Roadway Data Office
citeinfo.title: Railroads in Washington State, at 1:24,000

descript.abstract: Rail lines of Washington State depicted as linework. Each separately owned mainline route is depicted as a single line. Principle routes are shown with selected sidings and yards. Selected bridges and tunnels are depicted cartographically.
descript.purpose: This data set shows railroad ownership for geographic information systems at WSDOT. Includes only Surface Transportation Board (STB) decisions after 1996. May not reflect all rail banked lines.

idinfo.datacred: Washington State Department of Transportation, GIS and Roadway Data Office
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3000

citeinfo.origin: Washington State Department of Transportation, Goegraphic Services
citeinfo.title: Washington State County Series, Railroads

horizpa.horizpar: Positional accuracy has not been determined.

citeinfo.origin: Cartography Section, Washington State Department of Transportation
citeinfo.title: railall.dgn

srcinfo.srccontr: The graphics and attributes depicting Washington state's actively-operated railroads.

procstep.procdesc: The Microstation-format file "railall.dgn" was converted to measuring units of feet using Intergraph's "wu_setup" command, and the resulting file was converted to Arc/Info coverage format with the Arc command "IGDSARC." The resulting coverage was transformed to geographic coordinates with Arc commands "PROJECTDEFINE" and "PROJECT" and ownership attributes were assigned based on the Intergraph color code found in INFO's "ACODE" table. Uncoded lines were assigned owner values in ArcEdit.

A copy of the 1997 shapefile was made and edited to reflect changes to the state rail system as of January 1, 2007. CGIS contacted the State Rail office for some of the update information. A new field was added to reflect AAR reporting marks. The field for railroad names was filled in for all records. Orthophotos were used to determine more precise location for some rail alignments. The resulting feature class was checked for topology errors.

cntperp.cntorg: Washington State Department of Transportation, Geographic Services/CGIS

procstep.procdesc: Updated data. Owners were filled in where available and abandonments were updated. A date field for Abandonment date was added with some dates for abandonment known.

cntperp.cntorg: GIS and Roadway Data Office, Washington State Department of Transportation

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

enttyp.enttypds: Cartography Section, and Public Transportation and Rail Office, Washington State Department of Transportation

attr.attrdef: Ending milepost for the rail line.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Private company or public agency that owns but not necessarily operates a particular railroad.
Official abbreviation for individual railroad as assigned by Association of American Railroads (AAR)
Whether the rail line is active or abandoned

edom.edomvd: Rail is currently in use in the State of Washington.
Rail is no longer used and will not be used again.
An alternative to Abandonment where the Right of Way is preserved for potential future use as a railroad.

overview.eaover: Each line representing an actively-operated railroad is assigned an attribute value for its ownership.

cntorgp.cntorg: Washington State Department of Transportation, Office of Information Technology
